snippet: Critics were especially upset over dropping the word Canada from the on-air identification, and some suggested Quebec separatism was a factor.
abstract: Announcement that Canada's government-owned, French-language radio and television broadcaster, Radio-Canada, plans to rebrand itself as ICI is met with condemnation and anger over dropping of Canada in brand; statement prompts reaction from politicians in all parties in Parliament, from newspaper columnists and others.
lead_paragraph: Critics were especially upset over dropping the word Canada from the on-air identification, and some suggested Quebec separatism was a factor.

headline.main: Rebranding of Ici Radio-Canada Is Criticized
headline.print_headline: Change at Canadian Broadcaster Is Faulted
